WorkItem.ClosedComment:
Odd - could you try this out and re-open?

 - Try with Web Essentials disabled and report if the issue still occurs?
 - Try with .js files with similar names and report what happens there as well?

Thanks!
WorkItem.Description:
I came across this bug today. Repro steps:

1. Create a new MVC4 project in Visual Studio.
2. Add a TypeScript file to your scripts directory. Name it foo.ts.
2. Right-click on scripts directory, Add -> Type Script file. Name it foo.blah.ts.
3. The dialog will give an error message, saying foo.ts already exists.

This bug doesn't happen if you add a new TS file via Add->New Item dialog. Only occurs via the Add->New TypeScript file menu.
WorkItem.Summary: TS tooling bug: item already exists
